send.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to arrange for something to go or be taken to another place, especially by post
send.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Lyn sent some pictures of the wedding.
Monday is the last day to send cards by post to arrive by Christmas.
We sent Mom flowers for Mother’s Day.
We sent her a letter of apology.
I’ll send a copy to you.
He ordered coffee to be sent up.
send.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to make a message, electronic signal etc go somewhere, using radio equipment, computers etc
send.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Radio signals were sent into deep space.
I sent her an email yesterday.
send.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to ask or tell someone to go somewhere, especially so that they can do something for you there
send.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The United Nations is sending troops.
A police officer was sent to Ryan’s home.
Many of the refugees were sent back to Vietnam.
When Frank came, I told him I was ill and sent him away.
They sent me down to talk to Mr Strachan.
Mr Ellison is here. Shall I send him in  (=tell him to enter the room)?
The US offered to send ships to help in the rescue operation.
send.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to arrange for someone to go to a place such as a school, prison, or hospital and spend some time there
send.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I can’t afford to send my kid to private school.
He was sent to prison for five years.
I was sent away to school at the age of six.
New employees are sent on a training course.
send.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to make something move from one place to another
send.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The blaze sent smoke over much of the city.
send.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to make someone or something start to be in a particular state
send.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: His lectures always send me to sleep.
The tail broke apart, sending the plane into a dive.
send.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to arrange for something to go to another place
send.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The computer network cansend data at very high speeds.
Hesent a memo to board members criticizing his boss.
The companysent her a letter apologizing for the oversight.
send.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to tell someone to go somewhere, usually in order to do a particular task
send.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The Institute sent 43 engineers to work in Japanese laboratories.
send.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if something sends prices, profits, costs etc to a different level, it makes them go to that level
send.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The labor dispute at a copper mine in Chile sent futures prices lower.
